constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 156 (Friday, September 10, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. RUIZ:
H.R. 5238.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, section 8, Clauses 1 and 18 of the United States
Constitution, to provide for the general welfare and make all
laws necessary and proper to carry out the powers of
Congress.
[Page H4518]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Education and Labor, and in addition to the Committees on Oversight and Reform, and House Administration, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

title: Grandparent-Grandchild Medical Leave Act
